intro: Octomeria hatschbachii, commonly known as the rock lily, is a flowering plant native to the rocky areas of southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in dry, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its bulbs are underground storage organs that help it survive periods of drought. Octomeria hatschbachii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens with well-draining soil and full sun.
